N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 1010.7 - Positive test reporting

State Regulations
A positive test for suspected contraband drugs must be
reported as an Unusual Incident in accordance with Directive #4004, "Unusual

Incident Report," when any one of the following conditions apply:- A positive
test result for cocaine, heroin, or marijuana, even if no perpetrator is
identified.- Any positive test result in which an inmate has been identified as
a perpetrator of the incident.- Any positive test result which results in the
arrest of any individual, i.e., visitor, volunteer, contractor, employee, etc., by the department's Office of Special

Investigations or any outside police agency. Note: If the substance is tested by an outside agency, the Unusual

Incident Report will be updated with the test results from an outside agency
when the report is received by the facility. Notes
